description: A popular Amazon species, characterized by a patch of blue or turquoise on their forehead. The amount of blue varies greatly between individuals.
temperament: Playful, intelligent, and can be very affectionate. They are known for being relatively 'mellow' for an Amazon but can still be stubborn and strong-willed.
loudness: Loud. While maybe not as intense as the Yellow-naped, they can and will scream to get attention or express excitement.
vocalization: Very good talkers and can mimic a wide range of sounds. They have clear, human-like voices.
dietaryNeeds: An obesity-prone species. Their diet should consist of pellets, a wide array of fresh vegetables, and very limited high-sugar fruits and high-fat nuts.
healthPointers: Can live 50-80 years with proper care. Keep an eye on weight gain. Also susceptible to respiratory infections and sinus problems if not kept in a clean environment.
housing: Requires a large space. A minimum cage size of 36"W x 24"D x 48"H is recommended. Not a good choice for apartment dwellers due to noise.
